revised_title: Quantum Theory of Dispersion in Metallic Conductors - Part II
tldr: This article extends the quantum theory of dispersion in metallic conductors, focusing on the optical behavior of metals under circumstances where collisions of electrons with the lattice can be neglected. The author explains how the electrons in the metal combine the properties of free and bound electrons, and how the metal has an infinite conductivity for constant fields. The article also discusses the resonance frequencies and their corresponding -values, and how the absorption bands and spectral lines are affected by these properties.
